column4: The problems I encounter are encountered by man. I see it on the ubuntu boards all the time. People expecting stuff to work out of the box, yet there's a million problems. But that's enough of that.

and i occassionally type ubuntu vs windows in youtube and see all the ilities (especially performance) are better covered by ubuntu. But this is not statistically usable, neither your individual problems or the boards.
boards are the 5% collection of people with problems, youtube is the opposite, so just observe using more random conditions than "on the board"
